synthesis_conditions.additional_notes: 4-fluoro-4’-styrylpyridine (4F-spy) ligand was synthesized according to reported literature.

synthesis_conditions.method: Heating a single crystal of 1 to 393 K and 408 K respectively.

analysis.details: Bruker D8 Venture Single Crystal X-ray Diffractometer was used for collecting intensity data of single crystals.
Bruker D8 Advance powder X-ray diffractometer with graphite monochromatized Cu-Kα radiation (λ = 1.54056 Å) at RT (298 K).
400 MHz Bruker Avance 400 FT NMR spectrometer with TMS as an internal reference in DMSO-d6 solution.
Performed under nitrogen atmosphere with a heating rate of 5 & 10 K min-1 on a TA instruments SDT-2960.
Performed in a Mettler Toledo differential scanning calorimeter with variable heating/cooling rates with nitrogen gas flow.
Recorded using Varian Excalibur 3100 spectrometer with KBr pellets.
Carried out by using ElementarVario Micro Cube instrument at the Elemental Analysis Lab, CMMAC, Department of Chemistry, National University of Singapore.
Data collected from 173 to 393 K at every 10 K increment of temperature.
In situ VT-PXRD measurement of 1 for sequential Pawley refinement was carried out on a Bruker D8-Advance powder diffractometer.
Heating/cooling rates were monitored by JHC 10002L to observe the temperature changes of the samples.
